segment.documentation: BGM, A segment to indicate the beginning of the message and to transmit function, type and number of the message.
DTM, A segment to indicate date and time of the preparation of the message.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments to specify the document or message to which the current message relates, and related date and time.

segment.documentation: RFF, A segment to identify a reference which applies to the entire message, e.g. reference to previous message.
DTM, A segment to indicate date and time relating to the reference.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments to identify a party and related contacts.

segment.documentation: NAD, A segment to identify the liner service operating or responsible for a particular vessel/voyage.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments to identify a contact and its communications related to the party.

segment.documentation: CTA, A segment to identify a person or department within the party.
COM, A segment to identify a communication number of a person or department to whom communication should be directed.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments identifying the means of transport and related details.

segment.documentation: TDT, A segment to identify a means of transport and discharge voyage number.
LOC, A segment to identify the locations to which the following information applies.
DTM, A segment to indicate date and time of events in local time, else the time zone specifier is to be used.
RFF, A segment to identify the loading voyage number.
FTX, A segment to transmit general information about vessel/voyage.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 5: SG7 A group of segments containing information about the equipment and/or goods and its stowage location onboard a vessel.

segment.documentation: LOC, A segment to identify locations relevant to the equipment or goods carried.
GID, A segment to identify the number of packages of the goods.
GDS, A segment to identify or specify the goods carried.
FTX, A segment to transmit goods descriptions, additional equipment details or other relevant free text.
MEA, A segment specifying physical weights related to an equipment detail or a goods item detail.
DIM, A segment to identify off standard measurements (e.g. overheight, overlength etc.).
TMP, A segment to indicate the temperature setting in relation to an equipment detail.
RNG, A segment to transmit a temperature range in relation to an equipment detail.
LOC, A segment to identify the locations (ports) to which the given information applies.
RFF, A segment to give additional information on equipment or goods carried (i.e. equipment expected to be shifted at the next port).

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments containing information about the type of equipment.

segment.documentation: EQD, A segment to identify a single piece of equipment to which the following information applies. Only transport equipment size/type coded or plain language is used here further to identify the equipment.
EQA, A segment to identify details of equipment attached to the main piece of equipment.
NAD, A segment to identify the owner/operator of a particular piece of equipment.
RFF, A segment to specify a reference number to equipment.

segmentGroup.documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments containing information about dangerous cargo.

segment.documentation: DGS, A segment to identify dangerous goods related to an equipment detail.
FTX, A segment to give additional information concerning dangerous goods.
